intro: Pentaschistis andringitrensis, commonly known as the Andringa tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and endemic status.
